title: Isolation and preliminary identification of a novel parasitic algicidal bacteria
abstract: An algae-lysing bacteria called XD-G was isolated from XiangShan bay in NingBo. The algicidal effect of the bacterium XD-G on S. costatum 1115 is significant: almost all of the algal cells were lysed in 24 hours, and the concentration of Chl a was reduced by 66.5% then. By electron microscope observation, a large number of the bacterium could be observed in S. costatum cells after 9 hours' infection, which means that the bacteria XD-G is a kind of parasitic bacteria. Furthermore, the bacteria XD-G could not only lyse S. costatum 1115 and Skeletonema troicum, but also remove Heterosigma akashiwo.

title: Change of serum HLA-I level in patients with hematologic malignancies and its significance [J]
abstract: Objective To investigate the clinical significance of the level of serum soluble human leukocyte antigens Γàá (sHLA-Γàá) in patients with acute leukemia, lymphoma or multiple myeloma. Methods Concentrations of serum sHLA-Γàá in 112 patients with acute leukemia, lymphoma multiple myeloma were determined by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay. Results Concentrations of serum sHLA-Γàá in acute leukemia, lymphoma multiple myeloma patients were significantly increased compared with normal control (all P0. 01). The levels of sHLA-Γàá of Lymphoma and multiple myeloma patients were significantly higher than those of acute leukemia subjects (all P0. 05), but no difference was detected between lymphoma and multiple myeloma (P0. 05). The sHLA-Γàá levels in untreated and relapsed patients were significantly higher than those in the complete remission subjects (all P0. 01), while there was no difference between the untreated and relapsed patients significantly (P0. 05). The serum level of sHLA-Γàá was closely correlated with the peripheral leukocytes and contents of serum LDH as well as ╬▓2 macroglobulin. Conclusions Serum sHLA-Γàá can be as a prognosis and relapse index for malignant hemopathy.

title: On the application of Mobile Agents in distributed database query
abstract: The purpose of this paper is to use mobile agents to support the distributed heterogeneous database management system (DHDBMS) for information retrieval. With the characteristics of across-platform, autonomy and free migration, mobile agents make DHDBMS efficient in distributed database access, especially to loosely coupled databases on the non-specific Internet.

title: Expectation of low-carbon benefits on smart grid
abstract: Low-carbon economy has been a crucial segment in the strategy of sustainable development, and Smart Grid is the orientation of China's power system construction. The paper concentrates on the commonness of pursuing efficient use of energy source between low-carbon economy and smart grid, analyzes the state that the situation of energy source in our country goes against low-carbon economy in some ways, and summarizes the characteristics of smart grid's technology and development goals. Combining with the task of reducing carbon in power industry, it is expected that the construction of smart grid should have lots of benefits in the request of low-carbon economy, it is confirmed that smart grid manifests the superiority. At last, with the status of China's power system development, it is brought forward that some pieces of suggestion about smart grid construction in the era of low-carbon[Fund]: σ¢╜σ«╢Φç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║Θçæ (50677062);; µòÖΦé▓Θâ¿µû░Σ╕ûτ║¬Σ╝ÿτºÇΣ║║µëìµö»µîüΦ«íσêÆ (NCET-07-0745);; µ╡Öµ▒ƒτ£üΦç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║Θçæ (R107062);; σ¢╜σ«╢Θ½ÿµèÇµ£»τáöτ⌐╢σÅæσ▒òΦ«íσêÆ (ΓÇ£863ΓÇ¥ Φ«íσêÆ)(2008AA05Z210);; Θ½ÿτ¡ëσ¡ªµáíσìÜσú½σ¡ªτºæτé╣Σ╕ôΘí╣τºæτáöσƒ║Θçæ (20090101110058)

title: Practice and discussion of day surgery
abstract: Objectives: To explore clinical application value of day surgery. Methods: By reviewing the practice of day surgery in Affiliated Xinhua Hospital in the past two years, the average length of stay, average discharge expenditure and turnover rate in diseases of" lens implantation phacoemulsification" cataract surgery, painless abortion, ureteroscopic lithotripsy, breast lumpectomy, excision of vocal cord polyps, internal hemorrhoids anatomy endarterectomy between day surgery and non-day surgeries were compared. Results: It is shown that average length of stay is substantially shortened, average discharge expenditure is reduced and turnover rate is significantly increased. Conclusions: Day surgery could shorten average length of stay, reduce average discharge expenditure and increase turnover rate. It is an effective way to solve the problem of" difficult and expensive to seek medical treatment".

title: 3-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1-(2-nitrophenyl) prop-2-en-1-one
abstract: The title compound, C16H13NO4, was prepared from 2-nitrylhypnone [systematic name: 1-(2-nitrophenyl)ethanone] and 4-methoxybenzophenone by a ClaisenΓÇôSchmidt condensation. The dihedral angle formed by the two benzene rings is 80.73ΓÇà(2). The crystal packing is stabilized by intermolecular CΓÇöHΓï»O hydrogen bonds.

title: UP-1.112: An Analgesia Study of Periprostatic Nerve Block for Prostatic Biopsy
abstract: Materials and MethodsThe study group comprised 120 consecutive men (median age 68 years) undergoing prostatic biopsy because of either an abnormality of prostate specific antigen (PSA) levels and/or digital rectal examination (DRE). They were randomized into three groups: men in group 1 (40 cases) received 10ml of 2% lignocaine infiltrated into the periprostatic nerve plexus bilaterally; men in group 2 (40 cases) received 20ml of 2% lignocaine gel rectally; men in group 3 (40 cases) were recruited as controls. Systematic tenfold prostatic biopsy was taken in all cases. Immediately after the procedure, patients were asked to indicate the degree of pain on a 10-cm visual analogue scale (VAS).ResultsMen in group 1 had significantly less pain than the others (P< 0.001). The rectal instillation of 2% lignocaine gel did not reduce pain significantly (P= 0.083) compared with the controls.ConclusionsA periprostatic┬áΓÇª

title: Minimally invasive surgical treatment with per-pancreat region for sever acute pancreatitis.
abstract: To investigate the clinical effect of the minimally invasive surgical treatment with per-pancreat region for sever acute pancreatitis (SAP). Fify-four cases of SAP were divided into two groups, patients of group A (n= 28) were given minimally invasive surgical treatments (step 1: under local anesthesia, patients were put the home-made double cannula in the abdominal around the region of pancreas. step 2: patients with biliary stone were performed by laparoscopical operations). Patients of group B (n= 26) were treatment by open operations including biliary decompression, gastrostomy, jejunostomy, removing necrotic pancreatic organizations and puting the double cannula around the region of pancreas. Through double cannula around the pancreas area, all patient's cavity were persistently douched using 0.5% 5-FU saline solution. Washed after one week, two groups patient's drainage fluid amylase concentration were decreased significantly (t= 2.68, P= 0.013; t= 2.41, P= 0.028), patient's white cell count, body temperature, heart rate of Groups A were also decreased significantly (t= 2.32, P= 0.035; t= 2.39, P= 0.021; t= 2.38, P= 0.023). Compared with group B, the mortality, the incidence of complications, hospitalization time and total cost of treatment of group A patients were significantly lower than that of group B (chi (2)= 8.62, P= 0.001; chi (2)= 6.35, P= 0.014; t= 2.22, P= 0.034; t= 2.67, P= 0.010), but the cure rate was significantly higher than that of group B (chi (2)= 3.89, P= 0.045). Minimally invasive surgical treatment of per-pancreatic region for SAP can not only remove the causes, but also fully drainage and timely block the pathological vicious┬áΓÇª

title: 5-(4-Bromoanilinomethylene)-2, 2-dimethyl-1, 3-dioxane-4, 6-dione
abstract: In the title compound, C13H12BrNO4, the dihedral angles between the aminomethylene group and the dioxane ring and between the benzyl ring and the aminomethylene unit are  7.96ΓÇà(4) and 12.15ΓÇà(4)┬░, respectively. The dioxane ring shows a half-boat conformation, in which the C atom between the dioxane ring O atoms is 0.460ΓÇà(8)ΓÇà├à out of the plane through the remaining ring atoms. An intramolecular NΓÇöHΓï»O hydrogen bond may stabilize the planar conformation of the molecule. An intermolecular CΓÇöHΓï»O interaction is also present.

title: A Sub-Sampling Receiver Architecture for Ultra-Wideband Time of Arrival Based Ranging
abstract: In this paper, a new low-complexity TOA estimation strategy for UWB signals is proposed. It is shown that the TOA of the first peak of the received signal can be obtained with a simple analog receiver implementation which requires a sampling rate of only a few tens of MHz and allows to relax system timing requirements; at the same time, the achieved range error standard deviation is at centimeter level. A link budget evaluation under the power requirements imposed by the FCC shows that, with the suggested set of system parameters, maximum coverage is a few hundreds of meters in LOS, making this approach ideal for low-cost, short to medium range systems which require centimeter indoor positioning accuracy.

title: Relationship between raf kinase inhibitor protein and metastasis of ovarian carcinoma
abstract: ObjectiveTo investigate the relationship between raf kinase inhibitor protein (RKIP), a novel metastasis suppressor gene, and metastasis of ovarian carcinoma.MethodsImmunohistochemistry, RT-PCR, and western blot analysis were performed to examine the expression of RKIP in clinical samples of ovarian tumors and five human ovarian carcinoma cell lines. Stable cell lines over-expressed or deleted of RKIP were cloned to investigate the function of RKIP in ovarian cancer cells. The recombinant plasmids expressing sense (ss) or antisense (as) RKIP cDNA or empty vector was transfected into ovarian cancer cell line SKOV3 by lipofectamine. The expression level of mitogen-activated protein kinase/extracellular signal-regulated kinase kinase (MEK) and extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK) in ovarian cancer cells were detected by western blot analysis. Assays of cell proliferation, soft-agar colony formation┬áΓÇª

title: Dynamic supplying desired web service for e-business
abstract: With the number of available Web services growing large, supplying the appropriate services for e-business becomes crucial. Dynamic change of customer requirement and available service space challenges the service discovery and selection process. In this paper, we propose a Web service dynamic supplying framework, called Web service community (WSC), to facilitate invocation of one single service or the composition of several services to complete various business tasks. The prominent features of Web service description, discovery and selection in the circumstance of WSC are depicted based on the explanation of the structure of WSC. The desired Web services are dynamically discovered and selected by carrying out an efficient service supplying mechanism aimed at maintenance of demand-supply balance on the condition that the utmost satisfaction of customers' requirements is achieved. The┬áΓÇª

title: Characteristics of sludge in treatment of high concentrated organic wastewater by swim-bed technology
abstract: Based on the technology of conditional activated sludge process, swim-bed technology involving the novel biomass attachment material biofringe (BF) is one of the new and efficient advanced municipal wastewater treatments process. The process demonstrated effective treatment of high concentrated organic wastewater. When VLRs were from 1.7 kg/(m3 xd) to 4.5 kg/(m3 xd), 96% of average COD removal efficiencies and 80.7% of nitrification rate were achieved, respectively. The BF material allowed for attachment of large amounts of biomass. The mixed liquor suspended solid (MLSS) concentrations in the reactor reached 23 g/L at the highest during operation period, with holding 20-50 mL/g of SVI. An exponential law was found to be suitable to describe the variation of the viscosity as a function of MLSS. The granulation phenomenon of sludge was observed during the experiment. Protozoan and metazoans on the bio-film and suspended sludge were proved existing in the system by microscopic observation and DNA experiment. Observed sludge yields from 0.1046 to 0.1723 (MLSS/BOD) were obtained in swim-bed system.

title: Analysis on complex uncertainty for the run risk of ill reservoir.
abstract: see more details. By simplifying the complicated uncertainty relationships in the run of ill reservoirs to a grey-stochastic complex uncertainty, the evaluation method of grey-stochastic risk probability was set up for ill reservoir risk analysis. According to the functional function, the grey-stochastic risk probability was transformed into a commonly stochastic risk probability. Finally, the amended first-order second-moment method was utilized to calculate the run risk of ill reservoirs. The risk probability obtained by the grey-stochastic risk evaluation fell in a grey space, which satisfactorily reflected the uncertainty of reservoir run risk. Project instance analysis show that the proposed complex uncertainty analysis method can satisfactorily evaluate the run risk of ill reservoir.

title: Design of Image Measuring Instrument Numerical Control System Based on Galil Motion Controller
abstract: This paper introduces the main function of galil motion controller, and a image measuring instrument numerical control system based on Galil motion controller. Design of the systemΓÇÖs hardware structure and develop the numerical control system software in windows platform using VC++ software and DMC Win32 galil windows API function. The system we development have excellent management capabilities and real-time control capabilities.

title: MICROPORO MESOPORO
abstract: ZEOLITES, CLAYS, CARBONS AND RELATED MATERIALS The Official Journal of the International Zeolite Association The Official Journal of the International Zeolite Association MICROPOROUS AND MESOPOROUS MATERIALS Volume 100, issues 1ΓÇô3, 23 March 2007 ISSN 1387ΓÇô1811 Complete vol. 100 On-line Access via: www. elsevier. com/locate/micromeso 100/1ΓÇô3 Micropor ous and Mesop orous Materia ls Vol. 100 (2007) 1ΓÇô364 ELSEVIER (continued on the last page of the issue) Volume 100, issues 1ΓÇô3 23 March 2007 CONTENTS (Abstracted= indexed in: Chemical Abstracts; Chemical Engineering & Biotechnology Abstracts; Current Contents: Physical, Chemical & Earth Sciences; Inorganic Crystal Structure Database); Scopus An approach to carbon nanotubes with high surface area and large pore volume JJ Niu, JN Wang, Y. Jiang, LF Su and J. Ma................................................... 1 Liquid┬áΓÇª

title: Evaluation on the Effect of Individual Operation Designed for Unilateral Cleft Lip Repair in 60 Cases [J]
abstract: Objective In this study we evaluated the effect of individual operation designed for unilateral cleft lip repair. Methods Individual operation design was applied to 60 patients with unilateral cleft lip. We evaluated the plastic effect by using subjective and objective methods. Results In each case the score of subjective evaluation was more than 8 points. The symmetry of lips after operation was close to normal people. Conclusion Having clear principles, individual operation designed for unilateral cleft lip repair is easy to learn. It deserves to be popularized for its good plastic effect.

title: Species and Prevention Methods of Main Diseases and Pests on Rheum officinale Baill.[J]
abstract: The species and the occurrence of diseases and pests were investigated. This was the first cultivation of in Daofu County, Sichuan province. The disease didn't found. Two pests were identified to be Gastrophysa atrocyanea and Melolontha hippocastani mongolica. Among them, Gastrophysa atrocyanea was firstly repoted. By the field experiment, it was found out the methods for the prevention and cure of plant diseases and insect pests in its production.

title: Investigation and Proposal: Sheltered-ground Vegetable Production in Fuxin City [J]
abstract: investigations into the sheltered-ground vegetable production were made in 40 villages in 15 towns in six counties in Fuxin City. The result shows that problems exist, such as imbalance between different areas, necessity of improvement of unit efficiency, imperfection of input mechanism, a too small proportion of input, shortage of expert persons, poorlyness of technologic-service system, impeded channels to new vegetable strain introduction, too slow emloyment of advanced technology, imperfection of market circulating mechanism, poor effect of special technical associations and lack of a reasonable vegetable-strain layout and strong combination with market. It is worth popularising as experience that skilled personnel should be actively introduced; the three-level technological service network be set up; influential vegetable growers be introduced to promote the local vegetable industry; full play be given to the role of the local masses' organizations by firmly depending on the special associations; full play be given to the role of people capable of getting rich to promote the local economic development.

title: Audio ACP-based story segmentation for TV news
abstract: Story segmentation is essential for topic detection and information extraction in TV news. In order to explore to segment TV news in an audio perspective, which has not been researched much yet. This paper proposes an algorithm for story segmentation based on anchor change point from audio, which is different from the traditional story segmentation from video. The proposed algorithm mainly comprises three steps: potential speaker change detection, speaker change refinement and anchor identification. Experimental results show that the proposed algorithm can achieve satisfactory results with total accuracy of 87.84%.

title: Callus induction and browning prevention of Houttuynia cordata Thunb.
abstract: In this paper, we used the leaves of Houttuynia cordata houttuynia cordata Subject Category: Organism Names

title: Dynamic response analysis for non-smooth gear rattling system
abstract: For non-smooth gear rattling system, a general dynamic model with backlash consisting of two wheels with a sinusoidal driving is considered in this paper. Selecting the tooth face as the Poincare┬┤ section, the Poincare┬┤ map is constructed, and a calculation method of Lyapunov exponents presented by using the local map method to avoid calculating the Jacobian at the impact points. An example is given to validate the above calculation method. The results show that with increase in forcing amplitude, the motion state of the gear rattling system will change from single-sided tooth impact to double-sided tooth impact. The corresponding phase plane plots are shown. The spectrums of the largest Lyapunov exponents are calculated in a large range of parameters, and the results compared with the bifurcation diagrams obtained by means of local map method in the corresponding parameter range.

title: Study on the Relationship between Cumulus Granulose Cells Apoptosis and Oocyte Development in Buffalo [J]
abstract: The relationship between the developmental ability of buffalo oocytes and the apoptosis of granulose cells was investigated in this study. Granulose cells were analyzed on the apoptosis by Annexin V-FITC after the buffalo oocytes were cultured 22-24 h in vitro, and which was compared with the maturity and the scoring of oocyte as well as the rate of cleavage and embryos. Results showed that the rate of apoptosis increased with the maturity of oocyte. While with the scoring and developmental capacity of the oocyte decreasing, the rate of apoptosis of granulose cells was increased. The results indicated that the relationship between the developmental capacity of the oocyte and apoptosis of granulose cells was significant. The apoptosis rate of granulose cells could be a developmental potential predictor of the immature oocytes.

title: Establishment of TaqMan Real-time PCR for Detection Goose GHR Gene [J]
abstract: Growth hormone receptor (GHR) of goose was cloned by PCR, and the recombinant, designated pMD-18TGHR was constructed. In order to establish the fluorescent quantitative PCR (FQ-PCR) method that can detect the GHR, we have optimized the reaction conditions, amplified by FQ-PCR using serial 10-fold dilution of the pMD-18T-GHR as standard preparation. The results showed that the standard curve possess a good linear relationship by the method, construct the high sensitive and specific (can be detected in less than 10 copies/╬╝L sample) FQ-PCR method, accurate and reliable. The expression of GHR mRNA was different in liver from birth to 90-day-age, and there was different changing pattern in other tissues at 30-day-old in Zi goose and Rhine.

title: Strategies Coping with Challenges of Extremely High Watercut in Changyuan Oilfield [J]
abstract: After nearly 50 years development, Changyuan oilfield is in production with extremely high watercut, characteristic of cut-down of newly adding reserves and underbalanced reserve-production ratio, dispersed residual oil and increasing difficulty to exploite residual oil, reserves with low effects in adjustment and tapping potential and increasing production decline, and requirement of constantly improving enhanced oil recovery (EOR) technology, especially ASP (alkaline surfactant polymer flooding). In order to resolve the mainly existing problems in the extremely high watercut stage, it is put forward that, based on systematically evaluation of the potential for waterflooding, polymer flooding and ASP, the ultimate recovery factor can reach around 60%. Overall, the paper discussed future EOR methods and technical countermeasures on basis of exsiting development problems and potential analysis.

title: A CASE-CONTROL STUDY ON RISK FACTORS OF 410 MALE SENILE PRURITUS [J]
abstract: [Objective] To investigate the risk factors of male senile pruritus initiation.[Methods] By cross-sectional study, case group involves 205 male patients with senile pruritus who took health examination in our hospital were recruited as cases, while 205 normal people were selected as controls from March to May 2005. All the cases and controls were investigated with questionnaires. Univariate and multivariate conditional logistic regressions are used to analyze risk factors of male senile pruritus.[Results] The risk factors of senile pruritus were probably the following: the history of sun exposure exceeding two hours per day to last more than one year, without countermeasure of sun exposure, bathing habit including long-term using soap and overabundant bathing exceeding twice per week, smoking, lack of drinking water less than 1500ml per day and malignancy disease.[Conclusion] The male senile pruritus is asscoation with above-mentioned risk factors. Rational intervention for these risk factors could prevent and control of male senile pruritus in elderly population.

title: Application of cooling control technology of PAG quenchant for mesh-belt heat treating line
abstract: The quenching control system in mesh-belt furnace was improved by means of rebuilding the oil tank and applying PAG quenchant instead of oil. According to the process demands, adjusting and controlling the PAG quenchant concentration, temperature, spraying and agitation intensity and angle of impeller, the workpieces can get an ideal cooling effect which is rapidly cooled in high temperature area and slowly cooled in low temperature area. Due to adopting intensive quenching technology and complete heat exchange, the workpieces can obtain more uniform and higher hardness through controllable rapid cooling. Because there is compressive stress on the quenched workpiece's surface, the crack can be restrained effectively and the product quality can be greatly improved and the output is increased.

title: The Least-Dimensional Observer Design for SCR-D System
abstract: There are external disturbances in the actual systems. In order to meet the closed-loop systems' good dynamic response, the regulator must be designed in this case. Then the load torque (MZ) can be estimated by means of the observer in this system. In this paper, considering the load torque as external disturbance, we take the SCR-D system as an actual example. The MZ can be estimated by formulating augmented matrix to design the least-dimensional observer. It plays an important role in the design of the regulator.

title: Flow Interception Problem with Uncertainty of Total Number of Facilities
abstract: Since facility location decisions are frequently long-term in nature, there may be considerable uncertainty regarding the way in which relevant parameters in the location decision will change over time. How to find the initial set of facility locations to intercept the maximum expected flows is studied, under the situation where the total number of facilities to be located is uncertain but the relevant probabilities are known. An integral programming is modeled, and heuristic algorithms are proposed when the additional facility is at most one in future. Cmparing with the branch and bound algorithm through a computational example, the heuristic algorithm is proved to obtain good results.

title: Design and implementation of PLC FBD programming system
abstract: The basic conception, function and programming method of function block diagram (FBD) were summarized. According to the requirement of the FBD programming system and the IEC61131-3 international standard, a suit of appropriate data structure was designed based on object-oriented programming. The design scheme and the implementation based on VC++ integrated development environment for FBD programming system was also introduced in this paper.

title: Study on Flame Retardance and Toughening of High Impact Polystyrene [J]
abstract: With decabromodiphenyl oxide (DBDPO)/Sb2O3 as flame-retardant composite system, modified the high impact polystyrene (HIPS) performance. The effect of the flame-retardant composite system on the flame-retardant performance and mechanical properties of HIPS blending materials were studied. The results showed that when the mass ratio of DBDPO over Sb2O3 was 3Γê╢ 1, the oxygen index of HIPS blending materials reached 28%, and could get good flame retardance while the loss of the mechanical properties was small. The inorganic flame retardants could inhibit the burning of HIPS blending materials and significantly reduced the smoking volume. The effect of the types and content of toughening agents on the mechanical properties and flame-resistance of HIPS blending materials were studied.

title: A Laboratory diagnosis of hemangioma type of avian leukosis [J]
abstract: Using serological method and molecular biology technique, a laboratory diagnosis was carried out with the affected chickens from a layer farm in the present work. The serum samples were detected using avian leukosis virus antiboby test kit-subgroupA, B (ALV-A or-B, respectively). The positive rate of ALV-A or-B antibody was as high as 70%(7/10). The PCR has been performed against P27 gene of ALV group specific antigen and the detection rates of etiological nucleic acid in blood or liver samples were 66.7%(4/6) or 75%(3/4), respectively. The gp85 gene of ALV envelope glycoprotein had been amplified and analyzed by restricted endonuclease digestion, which indicated that the cutting sites of BglΓàíand SspΓàáexisted in the amplified target gene, and no fragment was produced with BamHΓàádigestion. It was proved that this disease was hemangioma caused by subgroup A of avian leukosis virus.

title: Pcanel/V2: A VMM Architecture Based on Intel VT-x
abstract: BackgroundAbstract With the rapidly development of personal computer hardware, to construct multiple isolated computing domains through virtualization technology has already become a future direction of PC. To avoid the difficulties caused by implementing VMM on traditional IA-32 architecture through software virtualization technology, the authors designed and implemented a VMM based on Intel VT-x technologyΓÇöPcanel/V2. Pcanel/V2 utilizes the latest hardware virtualization technology to configure a controllable virtual execution environment and run multiple operating systems directly without any modification of source code. While the accesses to hardware resources by the guest operating system are monitored, various sensitive situations which occur in the guest operating system can also be handled correspondingly by Pcanel/V2. Concurrent execution of Linux and VxWorks on Pcanel/V2 has been┬áΓÇª

title: Calculation Analysis of Closure Jacking Force and Introduction to Construction Monitoring Scheme of Incremental Launching of Continuous Rigid Frame Bridge [J]
abstract: Base on midspan closure by incremental launching of the Jialing River bridge on Chongqing. Emphasis on calculation analysis of jacking force before closure up, and adjusting the force during incremental launching according to actual measured data. Stimultaneously introduce to the keys of construction monitoring on measuring data. Hope to offer some suggestion and experience to similar bridges.

title: Extracting key postures using radon transform
abstract: Human key posture extraction will benefit for human action recognition, human action retrieval, human behaviour understanding and so on. This paper proposes an approach to select key postures from a human action video based on Radon transform. Cluster is used on the Radon transform to select the final key postures of human action video. The approach does not require motion extraction from the human action video. The experiments results show that the proposed approach is efficient.

title: Chain stores location problem with bounded linear consumption expansion function on paths
abstract: Many customers purchased service as part of routine pre-planned trips nowadays, instead of making a special-purpose trip to obtain service. With the assumption that the customer flows at most be serviced for one time, the decision objective for service providers is to find the optimal locations for such service facilities to maximize the number of customers "captured". This sort of problem is called flow interception problem (FIP). This paper proposes utility of each facility and concerns the FIP with bounded linear consumption on the path which is proportional to total utility of same path. Two FIP models with linear bounded expenditures under competitive and monopolistic cases are formulated. Two heuristic algorithms for two cases are developed and computational experiment is described.

title: Dynamic changes of soil microbial populations and enzyme activities in super-high yielding summer maize farmland soil
abstract: To reveal the characteristics of the dynamic changes of soil microbial populations and enzyme activities in super-high yielding (> 15,000 kg x hm (-2)) summer maize farmland soil, a comparative study was conducted in the experimental fields in National Maize Engineering Research Center (Shandong). On the fields with an annual yield of> 15,000 kg x hm (-2) in continuous three years, a plot with the yield of 20 322 kg x hm (-2)(HF) was chosen to make comparison with the conventional farmland (CF) whose maize yield was 8920. 1 kg x hm (-2). The numbers of bacteria, fungi, and actinomycetes as well as the activities of urease and invertase in 0-20 cm soil layer were determined. The results showed that in the growth period of maize, the numbers of bacteria, fungi, and actinomycetes in the two farmland soils increased first and declined then. At the later growth stages of maize, the numbers of soil microbes, especially those of bacteria and actinomycetes, were lower in HF than those in CF. At harvest stage, the ratio of the number of soil bacteria to fungi (B/F) in HF was 2.03 times higher than that at sowing stage, and 3.02 times higher than that in CF. The B/F in CF had less difference at harvest and sowing stages. The soil urease activity in HF was significantly lower than that in CF at jointing stage, and the invertase activity in HF decreased rapidly after blooming stage, being significantly lower than that in CF.

title: Dynamic characteristics of oscillating flow in pulse tube coolers
abstract: A dynamic measuring system is set up to measure the mass flow rates and pressure waves inside pulse tube coolers. An in-line orifice type pulse tube cooler is tested. Phase shift angles for different input powers are measured and compared. Difference of gas flow characteristics under small perturbation and larger pressure wave condition is discussed.

title: Clinical value of three-dimensional reconstruction of the biliary calculi based on 64-slice spiral CT scanning data
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To study the clinical value of 3-dimensional (3D) reconstruction of the liver and its ductal structures using 64-slice spiral CT data in hepatobiliary surgery. METHODS: The image data of 64-slice spiral CT scanning was obtained from patients with biliary calculi. Image segmentation was performed both using computer programs and manually, and 3D reconstruction of the liver was carried out using Mimics software. The reconstructed model of the liver and the ductal system was exported in STL format, and then into the FreeForm Modeling System for modification and smoothing, followed by image registration of the liver with the ductal system and the calculi. RESULTS: The reconstructed liver model accurately represented the actual size of the liver and its anatomic landmarks, and by adjusting the transparency of the liver, the hepatic and intrahepatic arteries, veins, the portal vein, some abdominal vessels and the biliary system with the calculi were clearly visualized. The calculi in the intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts were distinct in terms of the location and number, and dilation and stenosis of the intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts were also clearly observed. The model presented with realistic profile of the liver that allowed vivid 3D observation. The model also allowed zooming and rotation for observation in full views. CONCLUSIONS: The reconstructed model of the liver and its ductal system can be useful for preoperative planning and intraoperative complete removal of the calculi from the bile duct, and for the bile duct dilation and stenosis detected in the model, appropriate measures should be taken to reduce the┬áΓÇª

title: A fermented Cordyceps sinensis product CordymaxΓÇÉ6 improves sexual functions via PDEΓÇÉ5 Inhibition and central pathways
abstract: Cordyceps sinensis (Cs) is an antiΓÇÉaging medicinal herb with profound therapeutic activities in enhancing endurance and sexual functions (JACM 4:289, and 4:429, 1998). Sexual enhancement activities of CordyMax (CM), a Cs replacement fermented with Paecilomyces hepiali, were proven in humans (CTPM 9:29, 1988). We reported the activities of CM in antiΓÇÉfatigue and glucoseΓÇÉlipid metabolisms. We now investigated CM6 on the improvement of sexual functions in vivo. Male Wistar rats were given CM6 (0.32, 0.8 or 2.0g/kg) or a control Viagra (0.05g/kg) by gavage. Platelets were isolated after animals received 3 doses of treatment. PDEΓÇÉ5 activity was assayed, showing 23% to 40% inhibitions by CM6 therapy (p<0.01). In the 2nd experiment after received 3 doses of CM6 (0.6, 1.2 or 1.8g/kg), male KM mice in CM6/1.8g/kg group showed shortened mounting latency (p<0.01). In the 3rd experiment┬áΓÇª

title: An Invalidation Cache Model Based on Ant Colony Algorithm in Mobile Databases
abstract: Mobile databases are always the core technique of the dynamic data management. Cache technique, as one of the key techniques in mobile databases, is able to reduce the contention of bandwidth and save the power energy. As the character of ant colony algorithm is choice, update, cooperation mechanism, which is accorded with the mobile agent. An invalidation cache model based on ant colony algorithm is proposed. Mobile agents are looked as different ants which are able to divide the work. Thus, the optimum result is received. The experimental results indicate that the enhancement is practical.

title: The Study on the Application of Genetic Algorithm and Neural Network in Low Altitude Acoustic target Identification
abstract: When the neural network is applied to low altitude passive acoustic target identification, BP algorithm has a low speed of convergence and is usually plunged into local optimum easily. According to the advantage of the globe searching property of genetic algorithm, a novel algorithm combining BP algorithm and genetic algorithm was proposed in this paper. The simulation results show that the proposed algorithm can be used in low altitude passive acoustic target identification effectively and reliably.

title: Diagnosis and Analysis of Exercising Condition of the Overweight and Obese Middle-Aged People in Hebei Province [J]
abstract: A survey was conducted on the exercising condition of the obese middle-aged people for raising their life quality in Hebei by documentation, questionnaire survey and mathematic and statistic methods. It found out that the obese middle-aged people were much less mobile every day, some people liked just some single sport and spent much time sitting but little time exercising; they were short of the sense of exercising. It is suggested to adjust exercising habit and reduce the risk of them getting into health trouble caused by the static way of life.

title: Modeling of Variation Propagation in Multi-stage Machining Process [J]
abstract: A complicated machining process always contains multiple stages. Dimensional variation from all operations in the multi-stage machining process will be accumulated and transformed. In this paper, a state space modeling is developed to predict the dimensional variation propagation in the process. The procedure of the model is presented. The effectiveness of the model is validated by the real case study. The model has great potential in fault diagnosis in the complicated machining process.[Fund]: Θ½ÿτ¡ëσ¡ªµáíσà¿σ¢╜Σ╝ÿτºÇσìÜσú½σ¡ªΣ╜ìΦ«║µûçΣ╜£ΦÇàΣ╕ôΘí╣Φ╡äΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (2001.3. 1);; Σ╕èµ╡╖σ╕éσ╝òΦ┐¢µèÇµ£»τÜäσÉ╕µö╢Σ╕Äσê¢µû░σ╣┤σ║ªΦ«íσêÆΘí╣τ¢« (05-12)

title: Advancement of CT Perfusion and MRI Perfusion Imaging Research to Cervical Lymph Node Lesions
abstract: There are many lymph node lesions. The diagnosis of lymph node lesions mainly depends on the imaging test. Only using the morphology of lymph nodes, the differentiation of the benign and the malignant is so difficult. To accompany with the exploitation and application of functional imaging technique, approaching the nature of lymph node lesions from the angle of functional imaging become the hot spots. This article mainly reviewed the statue of the investigations of the lymph node lesions using the CT perfusion and the MR-perfusion imaging.

title: Ayalysis and countermeasures on ferroresonance over voltage of electric power supply system [J]
abstract: Based on the phenomena of frequent damage about power transformer in electric power supply system, the phenomenon, hazards reasons and prevention neasures of ferroresonance were briefly illustrated. Some operation experiences of adoptiong prevention measures aiming at such failure were concluded.

title: Isolation and Identification of Dadahol A From Mulberry Branches [J]
abstract: Lignans, with anti-tumor and other important biological activity, are a category compounds polymerized of the phenylpropanoid derivatives (C6ΓÇöC3). One of lignans was extracted with alcohol, and isolated by column chromatography and thin layer chromatography from new artificial triploid mulberry variety Jialing 20. Based on physicochemical characters and spectrum evidence, the structure of the lignan was determined and identified as Dadahol A, which relative molecular weight was 698, and molecular formula was C39H38O12. It was first time isolated Dadahol A from mulberry. These results laid the basis for the further research on the bioactive compounds and lignans from mulberry.

title: A study on ╬│-ray irradiation precuring of natural rubber
abstract: [en] Natural rubber (NR) was procured by ╬│-ray irradiation. The crosslinking degree and green strength of NR were studied at the different absorbed dose. The effects of ╬│-ray irradiation precuring on the final mechanical property were evaluated. The results showed that the crosslinking degree and green strength of NR were heightened with increasing absorbed dose at 0-100 kGy. The final mechanical properties were not significant different between the irradiation precuring and non-procuring of NR. This results show that the irradiation precuring of NR can be realized.(authors)

title: A study on sensitizing effect of polyfunctional unsaturated monomers on irradiation precuring of NR
abstract: [en] Natural rubber (NR) can be precured by ╬│-rays irradiation. In this paper sensitizing efficiency of two polyfunctional unsaturated monomers (PFM), Trimethylopropane trimethylacrylate (TMPTMA) and Triallyl isocyanurated, on irradiation precuring of NR was studied. The effects of irradiation precuring were evaluated by the crosslinking degree (l/M c) and Green strength of NR. The results show that TMPTMA is efficient to irradiation precuring of NR. However, the effects of TAIC is less efficient on irradiation precuring of NR at 0-100kGy. It has been found that the crosslinking degree and Green strength of NR/TMPTMA can be enhenced with the increment both of absorbed dose and TMPTMA content.(authors)

title: Qualitative Study on Psychological Experiences in Spouses of Patients with Esophageal Carcinoma Undergoing Radiotherapy

title: Mechanical ventilation treatment on acute respiratory distress syndrome in operations by cardiopulmonary bypass
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To explore the early diagnosis of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and the mechanical ventilation treatment in operations of cardiopulmonary bypass. METHODS: Thirty-four patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome were divided into the traditional ventilation strategy plus positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) group (n= 13) and the protective ventilation strategy group (n= 21), and their diagnosis and treatment were reviewed. RESULTS: The average ventilator-carrying time in the protective ventilation strategy group and the traditional ventilation strategy plus PEEP group was (4.8+/-2.1) and (7.2+/-3.6) days, and the mortality was 23.8% and 61.5% respectively. There was statistical significance in the 2 groups (P< 0.05). CONCLUSION: The key to ARDS is the early diagnosis and ventilation strategy. Protective ventilation strategy in treating ARDS is more effective than the traditional ventilation strategy plus PEEP, and it can obviously shorten the ventilator-carrying time and reduce the mortality of ARDS.

title: Novel Val606Met mutation in beta myosin heavy chain gene in Chinese pedigrees with familiar hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To screen the disease-causing gene mutation in Chinese patients with familiar hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and to analyse the correlation between the genotype and phenotype. METHODS: Eight Chinese pedigrees with HCM and 80 age-matched normal control subjects were studied. The exons in the functional regions of the beta myosin heavy chain gene (beta-MHC) were amplified with PCR and the products were sequenced. The relation between the genotype and phenotype was analyzed. RESULT: Val606Met mutation was identified in exon 16 in one family and Val606Met mutation was identified in 4 out of 8 family members in this pedigree and 3 out of 4 Val606Met carriers suffered from HCM. No similar mutation was identified in controls. CONCLUSION: The Val606Met mutation located at the actin-binding region of the cardiac beta-MHC gene is involved in the pathogenesis of HCM in this Chinese pedigree.

title: Dynamic lapping force analysis of spiral bevel gear lapping system with ultrasonic excitation
abstract: The rotational two-degree freedom dynamics model of gear-lapping system of a spiral bevel gear with single backlash was established by considering ultrasonic excitation and transmission error excitation. The formula of dynamic lapping force was established. By means of numerical simulation method, it is showed that ultrasonic excitation increases the dynamic lapping force between gear pairs. In the process of gear meshing, the phenomenon of tooth surface impact is appeared. When the ultrasonic excitation amplitude equals to 16εÇÉ 5Nm, gear-lapping system changes from periodic motion into chaotic state.

title: Synthesis, crystal structures and third-order nonlinear optical properties of a new family of double incomplete cubane-like clusters [(╬╖5-C5Me5) 2Mo2 (╬╝3-S) 3SCu2X (╬╝-X)] 2 (X┬áΓÇª
abstract: Reactions of trans-[(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝-S)2S2] (1) with 2 equiv. of CuX (X┬á=┬áClΓêÆ, BrΓêÆ, SCNΓêÆ, CNΓêÆ) in refluxing acetonitrile resulted in a new set of Mo/Cu/S cluster compounds [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)3SCu2Cl(╬╝-Cl)]2 (2), [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)4(CuBr)2] (3) and [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)3SCu2Br(╬╝-Br)]2 (4), [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)4(CuSCN)2] (5) and [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)3SCu2(SCN)(╬╝-SCN)]2 (6) and [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)4(CuCN)2] (7). Compounds 2ΓÇô7 were fully characterized by elemental analysis, IR, UVΓÇôVis, 1H NMR and single-crystal X-ray crystallography. Compounds 2, 4 and 6 consist of two incomplete cubane-like [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)3SCu2X] species bridged by a pair of ╬╝-XΓêÆ anions while 3, 5 and 7 contain a cubane-like [(╬╖5-C5Me5)2Mo2(╬╝3-S)4Cu2] core with each of two terminal XΓêÆ coordinated at each copper(I) center. The third-order nonlinear optical (NLO) properties of 2ΓÇô5 and 7┬áΓÇª

title: An intelligent disaster warning surveillance system based on video contents analysis
abstract: This paper presents an intuitive and effective method for automatic disaster detection in the early stage by real time video contents analysis. Via analyzing the specific feature vectors including spatial-temporal spectra variation, color/grayscale histogram variation, etc., a fully automatic detection process is developed to substantially extend the capability of the existing video surveillance systems, and to reduce the loss caused by these disaster events. The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm not only has the better performance but also avoids the extra cost than the previous systems. Moreover, the research work also meets the future trend in the related security industry products.

title: Optical trajectory diagnosis of 1.5 MA wire-array Z pinches with fiber coupled streak camera
abstract: A fiber coupled streak camera is developed and applied in Z-pinch experiments to investigate the optical trajectory of wire-array implosions with one-dimensional (1D) spatial resolution of 100╬╝~400╬╝. The 1D image of the imploding plasma is formed by a slit and relayed to a linearly arranged fiber array, which is capable of transmitting the 1D image out from within the vacuum chamber. A mylar film is setup before the fiber array to absorb the X-ray light while transmitting visible light into the fibers, which are coupled to a streak camera. And for X-ray diagnosis the mylar film is substituted by an infra scinllator, which converts X-ray into visible light and relays it into the fiber array. The experiments were performed on QiangGuang-1 facility. With the slit parallel to the axis of the wire array, optical measurement of time-resolved radial distribution of the imploding plasma is carried out as well as diagnosis of X-ray implosion┬áΓÇª

title: Research on energy absorption feature of ring systems
abstract: energy absorption ring systems SHPB technique Metals and Alloy Materials Packaging, Storage and Transportation (excl. Food and Agricultural Products) Dynamics, Vibration and Vibration Control

title: AN INVESTIGATION OF THE WETLANDS FROM BOHAI GULF TO LAIZHOU BAY
abstract: An investigation of the wetland from Bohai Gulf to Laizhou Bay by GIS and Landsat-7 shows that there are many types of wetlands, such as natural wetlands and artificial wetlands. This area has a wetland area of 15 060.29 km2. Natural wetlands have an area of about 10 071.31 km2, which make up about 67% of wetlands while artificial wetlands occupy about 4 988.98 km2, which constitute about 33% of wetlands in the study area.

title: Information Transmitted between Levels of Multilayer Buses System of Aerocraft [J]
abstract: According to the performance of 1553B bus, it is used more popular in the area of aeronautic and astronautic. This paper introduces the electrical system topology of the new aerospace, and builds the simulation platform based on 1553B bus technology. At last, research on the method of information transmitted between levels of multilayer buses system of aerocraft is done.

title: Application of AJAX Technology to Realize Real Time Image Information Distribution [J]
abstract: A method of real time image information distribution using the technology of AJAX is proposed. It can increase efficiency and enlarge application area in the information distribution. This method based on SVG (Scalable Vector Graphic) use asynchronous communication mechanism. Not only transport bandwidth is saved but also transport delay is reduced. An instance illustrates that the approach has better practical performance, and enlarge application area in the information distribution.

title: Synoptic analysis of a low whirlpool shear type-hail course with continuity in midsummer of 2004
abstract: Based on the atmospheric circulation and early days climate background, a regional hail weather course of low whirlpool shear type was discussed, the course occurred in July 13-20, 2004 in east part of northwest of China. The method offered by MICAPS was used to analyze the fields of physical quantities. Result shows that the influence system inducing the continual hailing is the low whirlpool shear of 500 hPa located at from northwest of Qinghai-Tibet Plateau to North China; the deep unstable layer and unstable energy increased with altitude is the thermal condition for occurrance of strong convection; favorable low layer radiation combination and high layer radiation dispersion are the dynamic factors of the strong convection and the going up air movement enhanced with altitude offered the water vapoar condition for hail formation.

title: STUDY ON SMALL INTESTINAL AIR-BARIUM DOUBLE CONTRAST EXAMINATION
abstract: Objective: To explore a simple and convenient method of small intestine double contrast examination-small intestine double contrast with air-barium by non-tube fast. To assess the value of new method and compare it with traditional method by taking orally. Moreover, to contrast cisapride with metoclopramide in new method. Methods: Take orally enteric-dissolved capsule full of aerogenic powder, which release carbon dioxide (CO2). Meanwhile take orally barium and cisapride. One hundred patients were randomly divided into study group and control group, 67 patients of study group apply new methods, and 33 patients of control group apply both taking orally barium and inject metoclopramide. Results: In study group, satisfactory, ordinary and no effect was produced in 53, 12 and 2 cases, and a patient cann't examine because of dysphagia. Total efficiency is 97.02% and average time is 34.63┬▒16.66 min. The control group has ordinary effect and the average time is 77.12┬▒32.98 min. Two methods are of remarkable difference in effect and time in statistics (P0. 01). Conclusion: Small intestine air-barium double contrast examination can have a more satisfactory effect than traditional method; cisapride is better and safe than metoclopramide.

title: New solitary wave-like solution and analytic solution of generalized KdV equation with variable coefficients
abstract: Using the solution of general Korteweg-de Vries (KdV) equation, the solution of generalized KdV equation with variable coefficients was constructed. As a result, we successfully obtained a new solitary wave-like solution and the Jacobi elliptic function-like solution of generalized KdV equation with variable coefficients.

title: Model Test Research of the Shore Protection with Vegetation for Wave reduction
abstract: For a new shore protectionΓÇöplanting vegetation on breakwater, geometric scale and experimental mode of the model test were determined according to practical wave parameters and existing experimental conditions. Cypress branches were chosen as the model tree for wave reduction, and factors mainly effecting wave reduction for shore protection were chosen to determine experiment grouping and operating order. Based on the analysis of the experimental phenomenon and data, some conclusions were obtained: the width of the protection vegetation on breakwaters influences the wave reduction for shore protection and the vegetation sympathetic vibration in wave reduction; oblique slope is more effective for wave reduction than level slope.

title: Development of port logistics of our country from perspective of development of world's key ports

title: Research on pharmacodynamics effect of Shenghuangketong ointment on mice
abstract: Objective: To study the antiviral effect of Shenghuangketong ointment in vivo experiment. Methods: Observe the inhibition effect of shenghuangketong ointment on the mice infected by HSV. Estimate the antiviral effect of the drug. Results: Shenghuangketong ointment had obvious antiviral action and the inhibition effect on the mice infected by HSV. There was significant difference compared with control group. Conclusion: Shenghuangketong ointment have obvious inhibition effect on the mice infected by HSV.

title: Research on the Ranging Algorithm for Low-altitude Radio Spread Spectrum Fuze
abstract: The correlative problems of spread spectrum technology applied in low-altitude radio fuze were researched and analyzed. The echo model was set up. The receiver structure and the corresponding ranging algorithm of spread spectrum fuze based on software radio were proposed. The performance was simulated and the results prove its is feasible.

title: Improvement of Polynomial Curve Top on Vane Force Action and Force Character Research of Composite Vane Pump [J]
abstract: Aimed at the phenomenon of disengagement between the vane and the stator of the submarine heat dynamic equipment, the force action analysis was completed and the model of the vane in the whole work range was built. Based on the least area of the opposite contact force, the polynomial skeleton line of the vane was optimized, the contact force of the vane in contact position and the area rate of the low vane were simulated, and the contact force was compared for the vane with center circular skeleton line and with single-side backward top. The result shows that the vane with optimized four power polynomial curve in the top has better character in the force balance and the lessening of disengagement than the other kinds of vanes.

title: Intravenous regional anesthetic effects of 8% emulsified isoflurane in rats
abstract: Objective To observe the intravenous regional anesthetic effects of the 8% emulsified isoflurane in a rat model of IVRA.Methods Fourty adult male SD rats (BW 200-250g) were randomly assigned into four groups with 10 in each, respectively receiving 8% emulsified isoflurane 0.5 ml (E-iso group), 1% lidocaine 0.5 ml (Lid group), 30% Intralipid┬« 0.5 ml (Lipid group) and normal saline 0.5 ml (NS group) for tail IVRA. The IVRA procedures were performed as follows: Rats were placed in restrainers wich allows free movement of the tail and slightly restricted movement of the body. After a 24 gauge intravenous cannula was inserted and kept into the tail vein of the rat, the tail was exsanguinated with rubber strips made of surgical gloves. Then an elastic rubber tourniquet (valve core sleeve of bicycle) was applied between the proximal third and mid third of the tail and 0.5 ml of studied drug was injected into the tail vein via the pre-inserted cannula. Ten minutes after drug administration, the tourniquet was released. To evaluate the analgesic effect, tail flick latency (TFL) was measured with a tail-flick unit (Ugo Basile 7360) at 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, 20min after drug administration and at 10-min intervals afterwards, until 120 minutes after total recovery. Anesthetic effect was evaluated by tail-clamping test with an alligator clip at the same time course as that of the tail-flick test. Meanwhile, the tail-flick test and tail-clamping test were performed at the proximal-third tail to act as self-control. Consciousness level was also observed during the experiment period. Complications of the tail skin (ulcer, abscess, necrosis) after drug administration were observed for two days┬áΓÇª

title: Research Progress of Bio-treatment Technologies on Polluted Soil [J]
abstract: Because of the problem of the polluted soil is more and more serious, its treatment technologies become the focuses on the world. The paper has introduced briefly the kinds, and the key characteristics, and the contaminated condition of our countryΓÇÖs polluted soil at present, and pointed out that the bio-treatment technologies are the most prospecting ways. For this reason, the article primarily probes into the trends of the bio-treatments by analyzing the principles, the effects and the applications of the technologies.

title: Design of Rapid-erection System for Ballistic Missile Launch Device by Using Fuzzy Contorller
abstract: A new method for designing ballistic missile launch device rapid-erection system is presented to overcome the disadvantage of erection system, which uses fuzzy controller. In the fist part of his paper, the non-linear model of the ballistic missile launch device is given. Then, the method to design the fuzzy controller has been demonstrated, and finally it is proved by simulation that this rapid-erection system has the performance of higher precision and using less time compared with the previous erection system.

title: CLINICAL SIGNIFICANCE OF PLASMA THROMBOMODULIN MEASUREMENT IN PATIENTS WITH ACUTE HEPATITIS, HEPATIC CIRRHOSIS AND LIVER CANCER [J]
abstract: Objective To study the levels of plasma thrombomodulin (TM), and to explore its significance in the development and prognosis of in patients with acute hepatitis, hepatic cirrhosis and liver cancer. Methods 59 patients with hepatitis and hepatic cirrhosis, 28 cases of liver cancers were selected into the study, the plasma TM levels were measured by ELISA, of which 19 patients of liver cancer in stageΓàáand Γàí were measured by the same method before and after operation, respectively. Results Except acute hepatitis, plasma TM levels increased markedly in the group of hepatitis and hepatic cirrhosis, the level of acute fatal hepatitis and decompensated hepatic cirrhosis were higher than those in acute hepatitis and compensated hepatic cirrhosis respectively (F= 389.19, P0. 001). Compared with normal control group, the preoperative plasma TM level of patients with liver cancer increased obviously (F= 55.64, q= 6.959-17.544, P0. 05). 10 days after operation, TM levels of plasma TM decreased to normal range in stageΓàáand Γàí (tΓÇ▓= 2.366, t= 8.372, P0. 01). There were obvious differences of TM between the three stages of preoperative liver cancer, TM level increased upgrading (F= 55.64, P0. 01). Conclusion As a marker of vascular endothelium cells damaged, the plasma TM levels can be used as an important indicator of the development and prognosis of some liver diseases.

title: Effects of filipin and nystatin on sphingolipids metabolism in human amnion epithelial cells
abstract: AIM To study whether macrolides polyene antibiotics filipin and nystatin have different effects on sphingolipids metabolism in human amnion epithelial (FL) cells. METHODS After FL cells were treated with two concentrations of filipin (0.2 and 10 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1) and nystatin (0.054 and 0.108 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1), respectively, sphingolipids were extracted and subjected to matrix-assisted, laser desorption-ionizing-time of flight mass spectrometry analysis. RESULTS Both filipin and nystatin affected sphingolipids metabolism. However, filipin (0.2 and 10 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1) mainly affected ceramide, and induced the generation of many new ceramide species. On the other hand, nystatin (0.054 and 0.108 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1) affected both ceramide and sphingomyelin. In addition to the induction of new ceramide species, nystatin also increased the concentration of several sphingomyelin species. Nonetheless, the higher concentration of nystain (0.108 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1) induced the generation of more ceramide species than the lower concentration of nystatin (0.054 ╬╝mol┬╖ L-1). CONCLUSIONBoth filipin and nystatin affect sphingolipids metabolism, however they may target different steps in the sphingolipids metabolism pathway.

title: Follow-up observations of tympanostomy tube sequelae in children with otitis media with effusion [J]
abstract: Objective To analyze the status of tympanic membranes (TMs) and middle ears after tympanostomy tube insertions in children with otitis media with effusion (OME). Methods From July 2002 to February 2006, tympanostomy tube insertions were performed on 158 children with OME in our hospital, of whom 58 (104 ears) were successfully followed up six months to four years after operation. Tympanostomy tube sequelae on TMs and middle ears were evaluated through case history review and otoscopy. Results The incidence of sequelae included TM retraction (21.2%), middle ear infection (12.5%), recurrence of OME (8.7%), tympanosclerosis (11.5%) and perforation (4.8%). Conclusion Tympanostomy tube sequelae are common in children with OME, and appropriate postoperative prevention measures and regular follow-ups are of great importance.

title: Moving Region Detection and Extraction of Geometrical Features in Sequential Images [J]
abstract: This paper presents an algorithm of moving region detection based on chroma, which is able to cope with varying illumination and shadow problems, and refines the detection results with morphology, by marking each moving region in the binary image, the geometrical features parameters such as area, perimeter and form factor can be extracted, which lay the foundation for the analysis and track of moving target. Finally, the experiments show this method is effectively.

title: Eco-physiological modelling of leaf photosynthesis and adaptation analysis of Chinese ivy (Hedera nepalensis var. sinensis) in an evergreen broad-leaved forest in eastern China
abstract: The individual plant of Chinese ivy can produce three types of branches (creepy, climbing, and reproductive) during its development, which adapt to different environmental factors. An eco-physiological model was constructed to simulate leaf net photosynthetic rate (P                 N) of Chinese ivy (Hedera nepalensis var. sinensis) in subtropical evergreen broad-leaved forest based on leaf physiological and mathematical analysis. The model integrated the rate-limiting biochemical process of photosynthesis and the processes of stomatal regulation. Influence of environmental factors (solar radiation, temperature, CO2 concentration, vapour pressure deficit, etc.) on P                 N was also considered in our model; its parameters were estimated for leaves on three types of branch in the whole growing season. The model was validated with field data. The model could simulate P                 N of leaf on three types of┬áΓÇª

title: Influence of hot rolling on cube texture of Ni substrate for coated conductor
abstract: Pure Ni and Ni alloy tapes with sharp cube texture and low-angle grain boundaries prepared by thermomechanical process were extensively used as substrates for coated conductor. The thermomechanical process usually includes hot forging and cold rolling. In this study, a hot-rolling process between hot forging and cold rolling was induced. The influence of hot rolling on the cube texture of pure Ni was discussed. Sharp cube texture on pure Ni was obtained by suitable hot rolling, cold rolling, and recrystallization treatment. This deformation texture of tape was studied using orientation distribution function (ODF). Orientation mapping, content of the cube texture, and grain boundary distribution were performed using an EBSD system mounted on LEO-1450 SEM. The results show that the substrates that are hot rolled have a sharp cube texture and low-angle grain boundaries.

title: Sound Velocity of (Mg0.92, Fe0.08)SiO3 Perovskite up to 140 Shock Pressure and its Geophysical Implications
abstract: New experimental data of compressional sound velocity VP for natural polycrystalline Enstatite (Mg0.92, Fe0.08) SiO3 initial specimens were measured using the optical analyzer techniques, and our former data were also revised. The VP showed two discontinuities in the pressure range up to 140 GPa. Combination with previous Hugoniot research, three distinct regions appear for (Mg0.92, Fe0.08) SiO3 Enstatite: a lowΓÇÉpressure phase (LPP, Enstatite) exists up to shock pressures about 64 GPa, while a mixed phase (MP, Enstatite+ Perovskite ) is possible near the high pressure part of this range; perovskite phase (PvP) was found between about 68 to 83 GPa; and then a new highΓÇÉpressure perovskite phase (NPvP) occurs at shock pressures higher than 85 GPa. Between 83ΓÇô85GPa, VP showed a negative jump. The solid to solid microstructure transition of (Mg0.92, Fe0.08)SiO3 Perovskite, caused by the high┬áΓÇª
